intro: Jacquemontia azurea var. parviflora, commonly known as the blue jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking native ornamental plants. Its unique coloration and ecological value contribute to its appeal in both horticulture and conservation efforts.
